s00_intro__core__description: The comprehensive guide to understanding, taming, and riding dragons for a harmonious existence.
s01_story__core__content: For generations, we fought them. We feared them. But one Viking dared to look closer and discovered a bond that would change our world forever. This course is built on that legacy of understanding over conflict.

s07_audience__values_01: I believe my symptoms are nervous-system responses, not character flaws.
s07_audience__values_02: I value autonomy, and I need to feel in control of pace, participation, and practice choices.
s07_audience__values_03: I believe systems beat motivation, especially when I'm exhausted or activated.
s07_audience__values_04: I think ethical support is clear about scope, safety, and realistic outcomes.
s07_audience__values_05: I believe small consistent practices compound, and micro-doses count on hard days.
s07_audience__interests_01: I spend evenings trying to calm my mind and body, especially when rumination kicks in at night.
s07_audience__interests_02: I invest in therapy, books, and courses when they feel grounded and practical, not trendy or performative.
s07_audience__interests_03: I care about sleep, routines, and small habits because my stability affects everything else in my life.
s07_audience__interests_04: I look for discreet tools I can use in public without drawing attention to myself.
s07_audience__interests_05: I'm interested in nervous-system education that helps me stop blaming myself for symptoms.
s08_values__value_02__explanation: I see setbacks as information, not proof that I'm failing. I want a process that helps me build capacity over time with small, repeatable steps.
s08_values__value_03__explanation: I value ethical guidance with clear boundaries and honest claims. I want support that avoids manipulation, exaggeration, or pressure tactics.
s08_values__value_04__explanation: I need to be in charge of my pace and my participation. I want clear opt-outs and stop/modify/reset instructions so I can practice without getting overwhelmed.
s08_values__value_05__explanation: I want to be treated like a whole person, not a problem to fix. I respond best to kindness that still gives me practical direction.
s08_values__value_06__explanation: I keep going when things get hard, but I need a structure that supports restarts. I value consistency that doesn't require perfection.
s08_values__value_07__explanation: I want my stability to improve my relationships and the way I show up for others. I value tools that help me be more present at home and at work.

s11_objections__objection_01__rebuttal: They are misunderstood creatures that reflect our own aggression. Treat them with respect, and they are loyal friends.
s11_objections__objection_02__rebuttal: Safety gear and proper handling techniques significantly reduce risks. Plus, scars are cool.
s11_objections__objection_03__objection: The price is too high for me right now
s11_objections__objection_03__rebuttal: Continuing in cycles costs more than it seems—lost sleep, productivity hits, and constant bracing add up. This is a structured skillset you can reuse long-term, and payment plans help contain risk.
s11_objections__objection_04__objection: I'm not sure this will work for my specific situation
s11_objections__objection_04__rebuttal: Issue-specific playbooks and multiple practice pathways mean you can adapt the tools to your triggers, your environment, and your capacity—without a one-size-fits-all protocol.
s11_objections__objection_05__objection: I need to think about it first
s11_objections__objection_05__rebuttal: Taking time is wise—start with the quick-start safety plan and one short practice, then decide based on how it feels in your body rather than trying to force readiness.
s11_objections__objection_06__objection: I'm worried this conflicts with my therapy or meds
s11_objections__objection_06__rebuttal: This complements care: it's educational skills training, not psychotherapy or medical advice, and it's designed to fit alongside therapy and medication with clear boundaries and referral guidance.
s12_advantage__uvp_02: Combines a clear 8-module pathway with guided audio, worksheets, and stepped support tiers
s12_advantage__uvp_03: Progress measured by recovery time and capacity-building, not perfection or long sits
s12_advantage__uvp_04: Ethical, scope-clear positioning as education and skills training—not therapy or crisis care
s12_advantage__uvp_05: Fulfillment on-ramp includes safety foundations, quick-start options, and private-mode participation
s12_advantage__comparison: Others teach you to kill; we teach you to connect.
s12_advantage__innovation: The first ever flight training program.
